lines.text: When a man says what's right, what's good, what's real, and what's true, then his mouth is ten feet tall.

Mrs. Popchik, as you know, the eye is the second most sensitive organ on the human body. Your young daughter's eye muscles are extremely weak. They can barely hold up what she sees. If any part of the human body has a tendency to break down, I'm afraid the eyes have it.
You know what they charge for an eye? An arm and a leg.

[Telling Troubles where to drop him off]
Mine's the next slum.
I can see with one eye tied behind my back!
Funny, isn't it? How many times your guts can get a slap in the face.
Hey, don't tell me my business. I've taped more hands than you've got in your whole head.
With the woman that you love at your side to stand behind you, a man can move mountains with his bare heart.
It was the late great Gloves Malloy who said how hard it is to say what there are no words for.
One minute you're standing in the wings, and the next minute you're wearin' 'em.

Gentlemen of the jury, the state cries out that the murder of Gloves Malloy be avenged. It cries so loud that I finished law school as fast as I could so that poetic justice could be served and so that I personally could prosecute the man responsible, Vince Marlowe.

[to Joey]
That ain't fair, kid. Your sister's eyes are below the belt.
Joey, Joey, after a girl's had a taste of mink, she can't go back to pastrami.
Can I walk you home?
New York's a free country.

[after hearing the bad news]
Only four weeks to live! Thirty days!

[as Dr. Bowan]
This is February, Spats.
Can you play the piano?
Like a mink.
Spats, it may not show up on the x-ray, but your heart is pure silk too.
Fightin's for suckers. I'm goin' to night school to be a lawyer. These hands are for readin' books.
The La Chez Maison is proud to present, in her eighth month, Miss Troubles Moran!
Here we are in the country, Mr. Marlow.
I'm fightin' in the Garden tomorrow night.
I heard it in the papers.
Go ahead, go ahead. Shoot. But killin' me never solved nothin'.
We cannot bring Gloves Malloy's death back to life.
Fight with them! Laugh with them! Love with them! And even die with them the death of heroes who will live forever!
Say, do you think you could write a Broadway score?
Oh, it's been my lifelong dream, for years!
The thing of it is...
[Chuckles]
I don't keep that kind of cash around.
You got it, and I want it!
That's right. I got it and you want it and you'll get it when I give it! Got it?
If any part of the human body has a tendency to break down, the eyes have it.
Why don'rt we go in?
Age before beauty.
After you.
The big guy only gives us three acts down here. Play 'em with style!
Thirty cents.
[after getting a $10 bill]
I can't break a ten, mister.
Don't break it - enjoy it.
Boss, I can't hold up the overture any longer! What shall I do?
Hold up the overture.
